name: Hilton Garden Inn Champaign/ Urbana

reviews.text: We traveled down to U of I for State science fair this last weekend. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was nice and quiet. The breakfast buffet/serve to order hot items was good and a wonderful convenience. The chef was super friendly and helpful too.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable and clean. I was impressed with the hotel hallways. It sounds silly but the moldings around the doors made it seem like a much higher end hotel than the price of the rooms.
reviews.title: Good place for college visitors

reviews.text: The reception and front desk staff were very helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone heading to U of I. Just as an aside, the hotel does not have connecting rooms in case you are traveling with a family of 5 and smaller children. This is geared more to the business traveler but they are very accommodating to get rooms next to each other if traveling with older children.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Excellent

reviews.text: I forgot to mention that they have fresh coffee in the lobby 24 hours a day and provide fresh baked cookies in the late afternoon!
reviews.title: Hotel Upgrade?

reviews.text: We stayed while visiting our daughter (for the last time!) at U of I. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Kids took advantage of pool and hot tub and said both were good. The king room was plenty big for 2 of us. The bar was small and closed early, though. We did not eat at the hotel, although we tried to order Sunday a.m. room service and told breakfast was not available for room service. Well worth a weekend visit.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hilton

reviews.text: Everything was great except the water in the shower was cold. The front desk said it was because they were "green" and the water was cold during "off times"...didn't make sense, but otherwise...GREAT experience!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: I have reviewed this location before, but after attending a conference there again this year, I want to reiterate that this is a fabulous choice for a conference, reception, banquet, etc. It is clean and spacious, and the catering staff makes the best breakfast, lunch, and dinner! I don't know anything about the cost, as I have only been a guest here, but the food is delicious and plentiful.
reviews.title: Great choice for conference, banquet, or reception

reviews.text: I travel for work and this hotel was one of the best experiences that I have had in my travels. Clean, friendly and had a full service restaurant. Everything that I expect when I travel. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, clean hotel

reviews.text: This is a beautiful, clean hotel with superior customer service. I really appreciated the little things like 24 hour coffee and iced lemon/lime water in the lobby. We had a party in one of the ballrooms and used their catering/bar service and got numerous compliments from our guests on the food, staff service, and their overall enjoyment of the party. The restaurant has delicious food and great service. I just can't say anything bad about my experience here!
reviews.title: A must if you're planning a party or reception in this area.

reviews.text: Very comfortable rooms. As all hotels these days shower pressure left something to be desired. Well maintained. Had a book in the lobby of different places to eat and designated those in walking distance. Meeting rooms a bit cool, but average for conference centers.
reviews.title: Business Traveler

reviews.text: You will receive excellent service from the beginning to the end of your stay. But, the hotel is in need of a facelift. The furnishings and decor in the rooms are looking worn and dated. The breakfast buffet is a bargain and the variety of breakfast items available is excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent Service outweighs dated rooms

reviews.text: We had a brief overnight stay in Champaign, IL, a college town notorious for no decent overnight lodgings. Thank goodness for the Hilton Garden. I don't have to think about it -- I can book with confidence that the room will be clean, the staff helpful, and the breakfast, if not 5-star, is certainly better than most. Staying at a Hilton is a no-brainer for us, and the Champaign Hilton Garden does not disappoint.
reviews.title: Can Always Count on Hilton!

reviews.text: Stayed here when attending conference at UICU and it was ideal. Good room, free internet, nice breakfast. Easy access to local transport as well as the shuttle bus to Chicago O'Hare. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very convenient, comfortable and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No fuss, no hassle, simply a fine place to stay for a few nights and seemed quiet enough to remain that way even if the Hotel was busier.
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best to have use of a vehicle though as it's too far to walk most places.
reviews.title: Restful Stay, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: We stayed here four nights and also used their banquet hall for a wedding reception. First the stay. The staff is very customer centered and will try to meet your every need. The hot water does take a while to flow from the faucets so a plumbing update would be in order.The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. The rooms could use a little updating in the carpeting and décor but were clean (except for the day of wedding when they didn't clean the room). We were in the room for much of the morning but left for about 2 hours or so and thought it would have been cleaned. I would suggest to management that the reverse side of the do not disturb door hanger have "Please clean room". They did bring us new towels and made the bed when we left for the wedding ceremony. The breakfast in the dining room could use improvement. You pay $10 for a buffet but it's not really a buffet. You give your server an order for the hot food and he brings it to the table and doesn't really come around to see if you want anything else.
reviews.title: Four nights and a wedding reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the wedding reception. The service was outstanding and would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn for an event such as this. The customer service was excellent. My only gripe is they only give you one Hilton Honor Point for every dollar spent and apparently this is determined by each individual Hilton. I thought is was kinda cheap for all the money you spend on a wedding reception. I would definitely stay at the Hilton again.
reviews.title: Good experience / Brief stay

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 1 night in this hotel due to flight snafus. We arrived after 10pm, were greeted warmly, and quickly got an extra pillow requested upon arriving in the room.
reviews.title: Quality business and event hotel

reviews.text: The hallways and rooms seemed nicer than several other Hilton Garden Inn's we've been in, and the firmness adjustment on the bed indeed made a difference.
reviews.title: business trip

reviews.text: The room was clean, but the sheets seemed a bit thread-bare.
reviews.title: Great hotel & conference location

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Champaign/ Urbana Hotel
description: Our Champaign, IL hotel is located just minutes from the universities, and features over 18,000 sq/ft of event/conference space. The Hilton Garden Inn Champaign/Urbana is perfectly situated to make your stay in Champaign/Urbana a memorable one. Hotel guests can enjoy breakfast, lunch, and dinner at the Great American Grill, located on property. If you prefer to eat in your room, you can order room service or take advantage of our 24-hour Pavilion Pantry for a quick snack. Both business and liesure guests is sure to enjoy our complimentary WiFi access, as well as our swimming pool and fitness center. Slip into comfort and end the day in our adjustable Garden Sleep System for a good nights rest.
